frameDefinitions: This frame concerns an Evaluee being judged for its quality, i.e. how much it would probably be liked.
A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.
The Military of a Possessor (either a nation, institution, or private individual) conducts large-scale activities in a Area to accomplish military or combined military/non-military goals.
An Item is located on a Scale relative to a critical value which is determined by some Enabled_situation.
An Exporter moves Goods across a border from an Exporting_area to an Importing_area.

An Item is picked out either by the order in which the members of a set would be encountered by an implicit cognizer, or by the order in which the members of a set participate in an event or state which serves as the Basis_of_order.
frameExamples: It 'll <t>cost</t> Sandra's parents fifty grand a year for her to attend that school.
These groups are known to have carried out attacks on international coalition forces <t>operating</t> in Afghanistan.
Several companies actually make most of their income by <t>exporting</t> goods out of the country.
The <t>first</t> car from the left is a Magosix.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
This role marks expressions that denote a scalar property of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item(s) whose price is being assessed.  <fen>Goods</fen> is usually an External Argument:
The person whose <fen>Asset</fen> is given up in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>.  This role is often expressed as INI.
The price of or payment made for the Goods.
The event that the <fen>Payer</fen> brings about by deploying the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The time when a transaction takes place.
The <fen>Force</fen> carries out the operation. Depending on the size of the operation, this may be as few as one individual or as large as the armed forces of a nation.
The <fen>Area</fen> in which the <fen>Military</fen> is conducting operations.
The nation, group, or situation which the operation opposes.
The <fen>Goal</fen> of the operation.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the operations are carried out.
The location of the operation.
The entity whose scalar property is specified.
The <fen>Scale</fen> is the attribute of the <fen>Item</fen> that is being described.
This role identifies the <fen>Enabled_situation</fen> by which the critical value is judged.

The conscious entity, generally a person, that moves the <fen>Goods</fen> across a border out of the <fen>Exporting_area</fen>.  

Very often, an <fen>Exporting_area</fen> will metonymically stand in for the person or persons directly responsible for the movement of the <fen>Goods</fen>.  In such cases the constituent should be labeled <fen>Exporter</fen> on the first layer and with the appropriate locational role on the second layer.
The items of value whose location is changing.
The role <fen>Importing_area</fen> is the place that the <fen>Goods</fen> end up as a result of motion.
The place where the <fen>Goods</fen> are initially, before the the <fen>Exporter</fen> moves them.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Exporter</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The kind of entity that the <fen>Item</fen> belongs to.
A usually spatial reference point from which the implicit cognizer scans across the members of the <fen>Comparison_set</fen>.
A kind of event in which the members of the <fen>Comparison_set</fen>, including the <fen>Item</fen>, participate in a certain order.
The entity picked out by the implicit cognizer as occupying a certain place in the ordered <fen>Comparison_set</fen>.
A set of entites of which the <fen>Item</fen> is a member and which are ordered either by the <fen>Basis_of_order</fen> or by the order in which the implicit cognizer focuses attention on them.
listRoleExamples: He gave me another lame <fex>excuse</fex>.
The Beaujolais Nouveau is dazzling <fex>in freshness</fex>.
<fex>These paintings</fex> are very pricey.
A holiday in Europe is very expensive <fex>for me</fex>.
The painting was cheap <fex>at $600</fex>.
<fex>Attending summer school</fex> is expensive.
No, they've got a special on; it's really cheap there <fex>on Tuesdays</fex>
<fex>He</fex> died while carrying out counter-IED operations.
Operations <fex>against Afghanistan</fex> continue to be carried out.
He was captured in a covert <fex>arrest</fex> operation carried out by an elite group of highly-trained Marines.
This sort of operation should only be conducted <fex>in open areas</fex>.
<fex>The light</fex> is probably bright enough.
It was <fex>hot</fex> enough to ignite the iron.
Can He make a rock too heavy <fex>for Him to lift</fex>?
<fex>The U.S.</fex> exports most of its peanut products.
Capitalizes the first letter of the first <fex>word</fex> in each sentence
Yes, I covered the cycle issue in  the second paragraph <fex>from the top</fex>.
Lorna was the third student <fex>to be expelled from the Academy</fex>.
Bennett is the fifth woman to be showcased.
The first student <fex>of the college</fex> to cross the ramp will present the name-card reader with a card having the name of the college printed on it. .
